newsitem.title: FRANCE: RUGBY UNION-FRANCE SUMMON MERLE TO FACE SPRINGBOKS.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-FRANCE SUMMON MERLE TO FACE SPRINGBOKS.

text.p: Powerful lock Oliver Merle is back in a revamped French team for the second test against world champions South Africa at Parc des Princes on Saturday.
Merle, fit again after a rib injury, was badly missed in the first test won 22-12 by the Springboks last Saturday in Bordeaux.
French coach Jean-Claude Skrela on Wednesday unveiled a team with six new names including Bourgoin winger Laurent Leflamand, who will earn his first cap, and two changes of positions.
The other players to come in are winger David Venditti, flyhalf Christophe Lamaison, scrumhalf Guy Accoceberry and hooker Marc Dal Maso.
Richard Dourthe switches from wing to centre while captain Abdelatif Benazzi moves from flanker to number eight.

15-Jean-Luc Sadourny, 14-Laurent Leflamand, 13-Richard Dourthe, 12-Stephane Glas, 11-David Venditti, 10-Christophe Lamaison, 9-Guy Accoceberry, 8-Abdelatif Benazzi, 7-Richard Castel, 6-Philippe Benetton, 5-Fabien Pelous, 4-Olivier Merle, 3-Franck Tournaire, 2-Marc Dal Maso, 1-Christian Califano.
